info.description: CRUD operations on a set of resources, including organizations, products, offers, entitlements, usage record groups for meterting, etc.
info.title: Suger API

get.description: list all buyers by the given organization
get buyer by the given organization and buyer id

patch.description: update buyer name and description by the given organization and buyer id

get.description: List all entitlements of the given buyer

post.description: Create a new draft offer or update the existing draft offer. When updating draft offer, the offer.ID is required.

get.description: List all entitlements under the organization
Get the entitlement by ID

post.description: Add the credit amount to the given Entitlement. The credit amount is accumulated & saved in the current Entitlement Term of the gvien Entitlement.

patch.description: Update the name of the given Entitlement

get.description: List all Entitlement Terms of the given Entitlement
Get the entitlement term by ID
list UsageRecordGroups for the given organization and entitlement

parameters.description: start date (UTC) in YYYY-MM-DD format, default is 30 days before the endDate
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: end date (UTC) in YYYY-MM-DD format, default is today
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: List pagination size, default 20, max value is 1000
parameters.name: limit

post.description: It is recommended to provide the ID in the request body CreateUsageRecordGroupParams, so the report can be deduplicated. All duplicate report will return error code 409.

400.description: all the quantity of usage records are zero

get.description: List usageRecordReports for the given organization and entitlement. Filter by entitlementTermId if it is given.

parameters.description: The Entitlement Term ID, if not given, return the UsageRecordReports under the Entitlement
parameters.name: entitlementTermId

parameters.description: start date (UTC) in YYYY-MM-DD format, default is 30 days before the endDate
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: end date (UTC) in YYYY-MM-DD format, default is today
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: List pagination size, default 20, max value is 1000
parameters.name: limit

get.description: List all integrations for the given organization.

post.description: For each organization, partner & service, there should be at most one integration.

get.description: Get the integration for the given organization, partner & service.

delete.description: delete the integration for the given orgId, partner and service.

200.description: Empty string if deletion is successful

post.description: Verify the given integration, check whether it works correctly.

200.description: whether it is verified or not

get.description: List all offers under the given organization.

post.description: Create a private offer under the given organization.

get.description: Get the offer by the given offer ID.

delete.description: Only the offer with status = "DRAFT" or "CREATE_FAILED" is allowed to be deleted.

200.description: Empty string if deletion is successful

post.description: Only the offer with status = "PENDING_ACCEPTANCE" or "PENDING_CANCEL" is allowed to cancel.

200.description: Empty string if cancellation is successful

get.description: List all entitlements under the given offer
List all long running operations under the given organization, offer, entitlement, crmOpportunity or partnerOpportunity. Only provide one filter on a request.
List all entitlements under the given partner
List all offers under the given organization & cloud partner.
list all products under the given organization and cloud partner
list the revenue records for the given organization, product, entitlement, or buyer.

get.description: list all products under the given organization
get product by product id

delete.description: only the product with status = "CREATE_FAILED" is allowed to be deleted.

200.description: Empty string if deletion is successful

patch.description: currently only the Fulfillment URL is allowed to update via this API.

Get the Bearer Access Token by giving the Suger API Client ID & Client Secret.

notificationContacts.description: array of email addresses of the users to be notified of any changes in the private offer status.

pricing.description: Up to 10 pricing entries are allowed.

start.description: in format YYYY-MM-DD, if VariableStartDate = true, this field should be empty.

originalPlan.description: the pricing plan of the original plan.

planType.description: The type of the plan, FLAT_RATE or PER_USER.

privateOfferPlan.description: the pricing plan of the private offer

setup.description: Not original fields. They are populated by other API calls

assets.description: Not original fields. They are populated by other API calls

featureAvailabilities.description: Not original fields. They are populated by other API calls

isBaseSchedule.description: There is only one base schedule.

key.description:
One part of a key-value pair that makes up a tag. A key is a label that acts
like a category for the specific tag values.

This member is required.

value.description:
One part of a key-value pair that makes up a tag. A value acts as a descriptor
within a tag category (key). The value can be empty or null.

This member is required.

effectiveStartTime.description: Time in UTC when the usage event occurred

messageTime.description: Time this message was created in UTC

planId.description: Plan associated with the purchased offer

resourceId.description: Identifier of the resource against which usage is emitted

resourceUri.description: Identifier of the managed app resource against which usage is emitted

usageEventId.description: Unique identifier associated with the usage event

effectiveStartTime.description: Time in UTC when the usage event occurred

messageTime.description: Time this message was created in UTC

planId.description: Plan associated with the purchased offer

resourceId.description: Identifier of the resource against which usage is emitted

resourceUri.description: Identifier of the managed app resource against which usage is emitted

usageEventId.description: Unique identifier associated with the usage event

resultMetadata.description: Metadata pertaining to the operation's result.

results.description:
Contains all UsageRecords processed by BatchMeterUsage. These records were
either honored by AWS Marketplace Metering Service or were invalid. Invalid
records should be fixed before being resubmitted.

unprocessedRecords.description:
Contains all UsageRecords that were not processed by BatchMeterUsage. This is a
list of UsageRecords. You can retry the failed request by making another
BatchMeterUsage call with this list as input in the BatchMeterUsageRequest.

operationId.description: OperationId: The Operation.operation_id value from the request.

status.description: Status: Details of the error when processing the Operation.

reportErrors.description:
ReportErrors: Partial failures, one for each `Operation` in the
request that failed processing. There are three possible combinations
of the RPC status: 1. The combination of a successful RPC status and
an empty `report_errors` list indicates a complete success where all
`Operations` in the request are processed successfully. 2. The
combination of a successful RPC status and a non-empty
`report_errors` list indicates a partial success where some
`Operations` in the request succeeded. Each `Operation` that failed
processing has a corresponding item in this list. 3. A failed RPC
status indicates a general non-deterministic failure. When this
happens, it's impossible to know which of the 'Operations' in the
request succeeded or failed.

serviceConfigId.description: ServiceConfigId: The actual config id used to process the request.

serviceRolloutId.description:
ServiceRolloutId: The current service rollout id used to process the
request.

code.description:
Code: The status code, which should be an enum value of
google.rpc.Code.

details.description:
Details: A list of messages that carry the error details. There is a
common set of message types for APIs to use.

message.description:
Message: A developer-facing error message, which should be in
English. Any user-facing error message should be localized and sent
in the google.rpc.Status.details field, or localized by the client.

creditAmountIncrement.description: The amount to be added to the credit amount.
The amount to be added to the credit amount.

newCreditAmount.description: The new credit amount after the increment.

awsAccountID.description: The AWS Account ID of the buyer in AWS Marketplace

awsCustomerID.description: The AWS Customer ID of the buyer in AWS Marketplace

dataFeedAccountID.description: The Account ID in AWS Marketplace Data Feed service

partnerId.description: The partner ID of the ISV/Seller in AWS Partner Network.

s3BucketName.description: The Name of the S3 bucket for AWS APN Customer Engagement Program (ACE) to sync the leads & opportunities.

s3BucketRegion.description: The region of the S3 bucket for AWS APN Customer Engagement Program (ACE) to sync the leads & opportunities.

secretKey.description: The secret key used to store the AzureIntegrationCredential in AWS Secret manager. for internal usage only.

accessKeyId.description: The access key ID of the IAM user for Suger service to access the client's AWS services.

iamUserArn.description: The ARN of the IAM user for Suger service to access the client's AWS services.

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key of the IAM user for Suger service to access the client's AWS services.

shared.AwsMarketplaceIntegration.description: The data struct to store integration info for Suger service to access the client's AWS services.

externalID.description: The external ID for assuming IAM role. If empty, means no external ID set or needed. Otherwise, it should be auth_id in table identity.organization.

iamRoleArn.description: The AWS IAM role for Suger service to assume to access the client's AWS services.

marketplaceStartDate.description: AWS Marketplace start date which comes from MDFS Full-Sync.

mcasFullSyncDone.description: Is AWS Marketplace Commerce Analytics Service (MCAS) full-sync done.

mcasIamRoleArn.description: IAM role ARN to allow AWS Marketplace to write to the S3 bucket and publish notifications to the SNS topic.

mcasS3Bucket.description: S3 bucket for AWS Marketplace Commerce Analytics Service (MCAS)

mcasSnsTopic.description: SNS topic ARN for AWS Marketplace Commerce Analytics Service (MCAS)

mdfsFullSyncDone.description: Is AWS Marketplace Data Feeds Service (MDFS) full-sync done.

mdfsKmsKeyArn.description: KMS Key ARN for the S3 bucket of AWS Marketplace Data Feeds Service (MDFS)

mdfsS3BucketArn.description: S3 bucket ARN for AWS Marketplace Data Feeds Service (MDFS)

policyArns.description: The policy ARNs in the IAM role.

revenueRecordFullSyncDone.description: Is AWS Marketplace Revenue Record full-sync done.

dataFeedProductId.description: The product Id in AWS Marketplace Data Feed Service.

puid.description: ID of the user, used as External ID of suger IdentityBuyer.

cmaFullSyncDone.description: Is Azure Commercial Marketplace Analytics (CMA) full-sync done.

secretKey.description: The secret key used to store the AzureIntegrationCredential in AWS Secret manager. for internal usage only.

expiresOn.description: The time when the access token expires.

refreshToken.description: The refresh token used to refresh the access token.

collectableAmount.description: The amount that the seller can collect. It excludes the marketplace commision fee.

disbursedAmount.description: The amount that has been disbursed to the seller account.

invoicedAmount.description: The amount that the buyer has got invoiced.

shared.CommitDimension.description: The commit dimension. There may be one or more commit dimensions defined in single product, offer or entitlement.

isUserCreated.description: Whether this commit dimension is newly created by user when creating AWS Marketplace Contract private offer.

length.description: The term length for the commit amount, such as 6 months, or 1 year. length is used together with timeUnit

maximumUsers.description: The maximum number of users for PER_USER commit

minimumUsers.description: The minimum number of users for PER_USER commit

timeUnit.description: The term unit for the commit amount.

id.description: uuid of the UsageRecordGroup (the size is up to 36 characters), if not provided, suger will generate one.

metaInfo.description: read-only, don't set it when reporting the usage record group.

autoRenew.description: Is this Entitlement Auto Renew enabled.

awsEntitlements.description: Nullable. AWS Entitlements from AWS Marketplace.

azureSubscriptions.description: Nullable. Azure Subscriptions from Azure Marketplace.

collectableAmount.description: The amount that the seller can collect. It excludes the marketplace commision fee.

commitAmount.description: The amount that the buyer has committed to pay. It can be the sum of payment installments if applicable.

disbursedAmount.description: The amount that has been disbursed to the seller account.

discount.description: The rate of discount (0 ~ 1.0), such as 0.1 which is 10% off. 0 which is no discount.

gcpEntitlements.description: Nullable. GCP Entitlements from GCP Marketplace.

gcpPlans.description: Only applicable for GCP Marketplace Entitlements.

invoicedAmount.description: The amount that the buyer has got invoiced.

x-enum-comments.EulaType_CURRENT: Current EULA, used for existing entitlement.

currencyCode.description: ISO currency code, Three UPPER_CASE characters

nanos.description: Decimal part of the price. For example, 2000000 = 0.002, 200000000 = 0.2

subscriptionPlans.description: Commit price plan, when priceModel = SUBSCRIPTION or SUBSCRIPTION_PLUS_USAGE.

usageFees.description: Usage based metering plan, when priceModel =  USAGE or SUBSCRIPTION_PLUS_USAGE

price.description: the Monthly subscription fee as commit.

endUsageAmount.description: The usage amount below which this tier is effective.

startUsageAmount.description: The usage amount beyond which this tier is effective.

description.description: Description: A detailed description of the metric, which can be used in documentation.

id.description: The usage metering dimension key, in format of "{plan_key}_{usage_dimension_key}"

name.description: Name: The resource name of the metric descriptor, in format of "{service_name}/{plan_key}_{usage_dimension_key}"

metrics.description: Metrics: Defines the metrics used by this service.

partnerId.description: The GCP Marketplace Partner ID, it is also called as Provider ID somewhere.

pubsubTopic.description: The resource name of the Pub/Sub topic to receive notifications from Google when a user signs up for your service, purchases a plan, or changes an existing plan.

reportBucket.description: The GCP storage bucket name to store the GCP Marketplace reports.

reportFullSyncDone.description: Is GCP Marketplace Report full-sync done.

reportStartDate.description: The UTC date when GCP Marketplace reprots start to generate.

serviceNames.description: The array of service resource names of the listings in GCP Marketplace.

account.description: The resource name of the account that this entitlement is based on, if any, in format ""providers/{provider_id}/accounts/{account_id}"

consumers.description: The resources using this entitlement, if applicable.

id.description: Entitlement Id generated by GCP Marketplace. For Marketplace pub/sub event.

inputProperties.description: The custom properties that were collected from the user to create this entitlement.

messageToUser.description:
Provider-supplied message that is displayed to the end user. Currently this is used to communicate progress and ETA for
provisioning. This field can be updated only when a user is waiting for an action from the provider, i.e. entitlement state is
EntitlementState.ENTITLEMENT_ACTIVATION_REQUESTED or EntitlementState.ENTITLEMENT_PENDING_PLAN_CHANGE_APPROVAL. This field is cleared automatically when the entitlement state changes.

name.description: The resource name of the entitlement. Entitlement names have the form `providers/{provider_id}/entitlements/{entitlement_id}`.

newOfferDuration.description: in ISO 8601 duration format, such as "P2Y3M". For Marketplace pub/sub event.

newOfferEndTime.description:
Output only. The end time of the new offer. Field is empty if the pending plan change is not moving to an offer.
If the offer was created with a term instead of a specified end date, this field is empty.

newOfferStartTime.description: Output only. The start time of the new offer. Field is empty if the pending plan change is not moving to an offer.

newPendingOffer.description:
The name of the offer the entitlement is switching to upon a pending plan change. Only exists if the
pending plan change is moving to an offer. Format:
'projects/{project}/services/{service}/privateOffers/{offer-id}' OR
'projects/{project}/services/{service}/standardOffers/{offer-id}',
depending on whether the offer is private or public.

newPendingOfferDuration.description:
The offer duration of the new offer in ISO 8601 duration format. Field is empty if the pending plan
change is not moving to an offer since the entitlement is not pending, only the plan change is pending.

newPendingPlan.description: The identifier of the pending new plan. Required if the product has plans and the entitlement has a pending plan change.

newPlan.description: When the buyer changes plan, For Marketplace pub/sub event.

offer.description:
The name of the offer that was procured. Field is empty if order was not made using an offer. Format:
'projects/{project}/services/{service}/privateOffers/{offer-id}' OR 'projects/{project}/services/{service}/standardOffers/{offer-id}',
depending on whether the offer is private or public.

offerDuration.description: The offer duration of the current offer in ISO 8601 duration format. Field is empty if entitlement was not made using an offer, such as "P1Y", "P2M"

offerEndTime.description: Output only. End time for the Offer association corresponding to this entitlement. The field is only populated if the entitlement is currently associated with an Offer.

plan.description: The identifier of the plan that was procured. Required if the product has plans.

product.description:
The identifier of the entity that was purchased. This may actually represent a product, quote, or offer.
For Private offer, "projects/project-id/services/product-id.endpoints.partner-id.cloud.goog/privateOffers/private-offer-id"

productExternalName.description: The identifier of the product that was procured.

provider.description: The ID of the service provider under Cloud Commerce platform that this entitlement was created against.

quoteExternalName.description: The identifier of the quote that was used to procure, such as the private offer Id. Empty if the order is not purchased using a quote.

subscriptionEndTime.description: The End time for the subscription corresponding to this entitlement.

updateTime.description: The last update timestamp. It is the endTime for the cancelled entitlement.

usageReportingId.description:
The consumerId to use when reporting usage through the Service Control API. See the consumerId field at
Reporting Metrics (https://cloud.google.com/service-control/reporting-metrics) for more details.
This field is present only if the product has usage-based billing configured.

approvals.description: The approvals for this account, that are permitted or have been completed.

name.description: The resource name of the account. Account names have the form providers/{provider_id}/accounts/{account_id}.

provider.description: The identifier of the service provider (SaaS Seller) that this account was created against.

state.description: The state of the account. An account might not be able to make a purchase if the billing account is suspended, for example.

reason.description: An explanation for the state of the approval.

roles.description: An array of strings representing the user's roles. Right now, it can be either: ** account_admin, which indicates that the user is a Billing Account Administrator of the billing account that purchased the product, or ** project_editor, which indicates that the user is a Project Editor, but not a Billing Administrator, of the project under that billing account.

user_identity.description: The user's obfuscated GAIA ID, which can be used to initiate Open ID Connect.

id.description: The ID of the API Client.

secret.description: The secret of the API Client.

buyerID.description: Optional, if available, return the report for the Buyer.

entitlementID.description: Optional, if available, return the report for the Entitlement.

organizationID.description: Required. If the productID & entitlementID are emtpy, return the report for the entire Organization.

productID.description: Optional, if available, return the report for the Product.

acquiredOn.description: UTC timestamp on receiving the auth response

shared.MeteringDimension.description: The dimension to meter usage in entitlement.

includedBaseQuantities.description: how many quantities of this dimension are included in the commit.

usageCount.description: The current Dimension Usage Count. Available when call GetEntitlement API.

originRecords.description: The original records reported by the customer before convertion. If no dimension mapping is applied, this field is the same as the records field.

awsMeteringResponse.description: The raw response from AWS metering service.

azureMeteringResponse.description: The raw response from Azure metering service.

commitAmount.description: The amount of the commit if applicable.

creditAmount.description: The amount of the credit if applicable.

creditRecords.description: The credit usage records in the map of <DimensionKey, Count>

dimensionUnitPrice.description: The unit price of each dimension in the map of <DimensionKey, UnitPrice>

endTime.description: time in UTC when the UsageRecordReport ends

gcpMeteringResponse.description: The raw response from GCP metering service.

includedRecords.description: The included usage records in the map of <DimensionKey, Count>

reportedRecords.description: The reported usage records in the map of <DimensionKey, Count>

startTime.description: time in UTC when the UsageRecordReport starts

usageRecordGroupIds.description: The IDs of UsageRecordGroups aggregated in this UsageRecordReport.

usedCommitAmount.description: The amount of the used commit before the this usage record report if applicable.

usedCommitAmountIncrement.description: The amount of the used commit increment in this usage record report if applicable.

usedCreditAmount.description: The amount of the used credit before the this usage record report if applicable.

usedCreditAmountIncrement.description: The amount of the used credit increment in this usage record report if applicable.

lastUpdateTime.description: timestamp of the event when it is updated.

timestamp.description: timestamp of the event when it is scheduled or created.

x-enum-comments.NotificationEventAction_NOTIFY_CONTACTS: Notify the contacts when the offer is pending acceptance

azureOriginalPlan.description: The origin pricing of Azure plan. Only applicable for Azure Marketplace plans.

azurePrivateOffer.description: The private offer for Azure Marketplace. Only applicable for Azure Marketplace private offers.

buyerAwsAccountIds.description: The buyers' AWS Account IDs of this offer.

buyerAzureTenants.description: The buyers' Azure tenants of this offer.

discount.description: The rate of discount (0 ~ 1.0), such as 0.1 which is 10% off. 0 which is no discount.

gcpMetrics.description: Only applicable for GCP Marketplace Offers (the default or private offer)

gcpPlans.description: Only applicable for GCP Marketplace Offers (the default or private offer).

paymentInstallments.description: For flexible payment schedule. Not empty if it is enabled.

privateOfferUrl.description: The URL of the private offer sent to buyers to accept. Only applicable for private offer.

visibility.description: The default visibility of offer is PRIVATE.

baseAgreementId.description: Applicable for AWS Marketplace only, when the IsAgreementBasedOffer is true.

contacts.description: The contacts of the offer to notify if any updates.

isAgreementBasedOffer.description: Applicable for AWS Marketplace only, If this offer is agreement based offer.

isRenewalOffer.description: Applicable for AWS Marketplace only, If this offer is renewal offer.

notifications.description: The notifications of the offer if any updates. In most cases, it is to notify contacts/buyers when the offer is pending acceptance.

amount.description: The revenue amount for the revenue report

collectableAmount.description: The revenue amount that the seller/ISV can collect.

currency.description: The currency of the revenue in ISO 4217 format, such as "USD".

date.description: The date for the revenue report

awsRevenueRecords.description: For raw revenue records in AWS Marketplace

azureRevenueRecords.description: For raw revenue records in Azure Marketplace

gcpRevenueRecords.description: For raw revenue records in GCP Marketplace

subdomain.description: User defined when setting up the integration

scope.description: The scope of the access token. multiple scopes are separated by comma.

creditCount.description: The count of this dimension usage records that are handled as credit.

includedCount.description: The count of this dimension usage records that are handled as included in IncludedBaseQuantity

reportedCount.description: The count of this dimension usage records that are reported to cloud vendors.

valid.description: Valid is true if Time is not NULL

customerIdentifier.description:
The customer identifier is a handle to each unique customer in an application.
Customer identifiers are obtained through the ResolveCustomer operation in AWS
Marketplace Metering Service.

dimension.description:
The dimension for which the given entitlement applies. Dimensions represent
categories of capacity in a product and are specified when the product is listed
in AWS Marketplace.

expirationDate.description:
The expiration date represents the minimum date through which this entitlement
is expected to remain valid. For contractual products listed on AWS Marketplace,
the expiration date is the date at which the customer will renew or cancel their
contract. Customers who are opting to renew their contract will still have
entitlements with an expiration date.

productCode.description:
The product code for which the given entitlement applies. Product codes are
provided by AWS Marketplace when the product listing is created.

value.description:
The EntitlementValue represents the amount of capacity that the customer is
entitled to for the product.

allocatedUsageQuantity.description:
The total quantity allocated to this bucket of usage.

This member is required.

tags.description:
The set of tags that define the bucket of usage. For the bucket of items with no
tags, this parameter can be left out.

customerIdentifier.description:
The CustomerIdentifier is obtained through the ResolveCustomer operation and
represents an individual buyer in your application.

This member is required.

dimension.description:
During the process of registering a product on AWS Marketplace, dimensions are
specified. These represent different units of value in your application.

This member is required.

quantity.description:
The quantity of usage consumed by the customer for the given dimension and time.
Defaults to 0 if not specified.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp, in UTC, for which the usage is being reported. Your application can
meter usage for up to one hour in the past. Make sure the timestamp value is not
before the start of the software usage.

This member is required.

usageAllocations.description:
The set of UsageAllocations to submit. The sum of all UsageAllocation quantities
must equal the Quantity of the UsageRecord.

meteringRecordId.description: The MeteringRecordId is a unique identifier for this metering event.

status.description:
The UsageRecordResultStatus indicates the status of an individual UsageRecord
processed by BatchMeterUsage.

* Success- The UsageRecord was accepted and
honored by BatchMeterUsage.

* CustomerNotSubscribed- The CustomerIdentifier
specified is not able to use your product. The UsageRecord was not honored.
There are three causes for this result:

* The customer identifier is
invalid.

* The customer identifier provided in the metering record does not
have an active agreement or subscription with this product. Future UsageRecords
for this customer will fail until the customer subscribes to your product.

*
The customer's AWS account was suspended.

* DuplicateRecord- Indicates that the
UsageRecord was invalid and not honored. A previously metered UsageRecord had
the same customer, dimension, and time, but a different quantity.

usageRecord.description: The UsageRecord that was part of the BatchMeterUsage request.

BearerTokenAuth.description: Bearer token for authorization, it is from the API GetApiClientAccessToken.
BearerTokenAuth.name: Authorization
